sense.name: display or publish something publically
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] POST NP2 PP[locative] Note: includes specific financial sense of making entries in ledgers, and transferring information from accounts receivable (AR) or accounts payable (AP) to ledgers.
sense.examples: I'll post the news on the bulletin board. Can you post a warning at the dump? You need an account to post your resume on our site. Please post comment on this blog. The journal page reference and date entry was posted to the ledger. Posting process has to be run in to post AR to Customer balance. The bank posted the fee as a debit.

sense.name: assign to a station or duty
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 POST NP2[patient[human]] PP[locative]
sense.examples: Please post a security guard at the exit. The newspaper posted him in Timbuktu. The company posted her to a huge mine in north Queensland.

sense.name: send or transmit mail
sense.examples: I'll post your the paper when it's written. Post me your latest result by email. That company keeps on posting me junk mail.

sense.name: GAME, SPORTS - score something
sense.examples: He posted a win in his first game of the season. He posted 16 double-doubles in his 85-game career. last year, the team posted a 4-2 mark in the shootout.

sense.name: RIDING - keep rhythm with the horse
sense.commentary: Note: To bob up and down in the saddle in time with a horse's trot.
sense.examples: You want me to post a horse into the canter from a long trot?

sense.name: physically drive a post into the ground
sense.examples: Triumphantly, he posted a stake in the ground.

sense.name: mark or be branded
sense.examples: Post that man as a thief!

sense.name: to put forward
sense.examples: He posted a bail and was released. The bail was posted at $5000 cash.
